books.title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
books.author: Edgar Rice Burroughs
books.summary: When the beautiful Princess Thuvia of Ptarth is kidnapped, suspicion falls on John Carter’s son Carthoris, who sets out to rescue the woman he loves.

books.title: Waverley
books.author: Walter Scott
books.summary: A young English officer becomes involved in the Jacobite rebellion.

books.title: The Enormous Room
books.author: E. E. Cummings
books.summary: E. E. Cummings describes the experiences of his and his fellow inmates’ imprisonment during World War I.

books.title: A General History of the Pirates
books.author: Captain Charles Johnson
books.summary: The lives and stories of the daring pirate outlaws who terrorized the Atlantic Ocean and Caribbean Sea in the 18th century.

books.title: The Railway Children
books.author: E. Nesbit
books.summary: After their father is forced to leave them, three children and their mother must live in near-poverty in the country, where their lives are enlivened by the nearby presence of a railway line.

books.title: A Gentleman of Leisure
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: Jimmy Pitt gets much more than he bargained for when he bets his friends at the Strollers’ Club that he can successfully burgle a house.

books.title: All’s Well That Ends Well
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: A woman tricks her husband into fulfilling his marriage demands.

books.title: The Charwoman’s Shadow
books.author: Lord Dunsany
books.summary: A young nobleman becomes a magician to secure his sister’s marriage.

books.title: Riders of the Purple Sage
books.author: Zane Grey
books.summary: On a ranch in southern Utah, Jane Withersteen refuses to marry a local church elder, and together with her ranch hand and a mysterious gunman she must face retaliatory violence, theft, and murder.

books.title: Brood of the Witch-Queen
books.author: Sax Rohmer
books.summary: A father and son duo investigate a man who is wielding ancient Egyptian magic.

books.title: Commentaries on the Gallic War
books.author: Julius Caesar
books.summary: Julius Caesar’s account of the conflicts between Rome and Gaul in the later years of the Roman republic.

books.title: The Clue
books.author: Carolyn Wells
books.summary: A young woman is found dead under mysterious circumstances, and the discovery of a single but significant clue ends up uncovering more than anyone could have expected.

books.title: A Daughter of the Samurai
books.author: Etsu Inagaki Sugimoto
books.summary: The autobiography of Etsu Sugimoto, a girl born into a samurai family in a time of great cultural changes.

books.title: Nicomachean Ethics
books.author: Aristotle
books.summary: Aristotle examines how one may live in the most thriving, excellent manner.

books.title: Paradise Lost
books.author: John Milton
books.summary: A dramatic imagining in blank verse of the rebellion of Satan against God, Satan’s overthrow, and the Fall of Man.

books.title: Zuleika Dobson
books.author: Max Beerbohm
books.summary: A beautiful magician unsuspectingly casts her charms on quiet Oxford.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Andre Norton
books.summary: A collection of fantasy and science fiction short fiction by Andre Norton.

books.title: Poirot Investigates
books.author: Agatha Christie
books.summary: A calculating Belgian detective and his wide-eyed companion investigate and solve a series of mysteries.

books.title: Gitanjali
books.author: Rabindranath Tagore
books.summary: Prose poems of offering translated by the author from the original Bengali.

books.title: Through the Brazilian Wilderness
books.author: Theodore Roosevelt
books.summary: Theodore Roosevelt’s autobiographical account of his expedition into the uncharted depths of the Brazilian rainforest.
